items.q: Which silent film era director created the sci-fi epic 'Metropolis'?
items.explanation: He directed the highly ambitious film in Germany.

items.q: In the original Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale, the Little Mermaid marries the prince.
items.explanation: She fails to win him and dissolves into sea foam.

items.q: The first official Academy Award ceremony in 1929 was broadcast on live television.
items.explanation: It was a private dinner held long before widespread television.

items.q: What 1972 John Waters film starred the drag queen Divine and advertised itself as 'an exercise in poor taste'?
items.explanation: The shocking film became a classic of the midnight movie circuit.

items.q: Which author originally wrote 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' as a BBC radio comedy?
items.explanation: He later adapted the popular radio show into a bestselling book series.

items.q: What influential 1966 album did The Beach Boys release as a response to The Beatles' 'Rubber Soul'?
items.explanation: Brian Wilson produced the complex album to push the boundaries of pop music.

items.q: In film theory, what does 'mise-en-sc√®ne' refer to?
items.a: The arrangement of everything that appears in the framing of the camera.
items.explanation: This includes the actors, lighting, decor, props, and costume.

items.q: What famous 1938 radio broadcast, directed by Orson Welles, supposedly caused mass panic among listeners?
items.explanation: Listeners believed a real martian invasion was happening.

items.q: Which notoriously reclusive director made the films 'The Tree of Life' and 'Days of Heaven'?
items.explanation: He is known for his philosophical themes and visually stunning cinematography.

items.q: What classic 1950 film noir stars Gloria Swanson as faded silent movie star Norma Desmond?
items.explanation: The film offers a dark and cynical look at Hollywood.
